author: costin
msg: Moved facades to a different package. This will improve the readability of tomcat and
provide a clear separation between layers. In addition, the security-sensitive code will
be clearly demarcated and we open the possibility of making the facade a plug-in.
Changes:
- all facades are now package-level classes ( non-public), only the methods in servlet API
are public.
- all communication between facade and core is controled by FacadeManager interface.
- also, package.html contains some documentation about facades.
- changed the method to access the internal objects, you can't cast to Facade and call getReal.
You need to get an instance of FacadeManager ( right now we use a tomcat-specific
context attribute). The application must have a "trusted" attribute in server.xml.
The FacadeManager can't be used to access objects from a different context.
- few changes in ServletWrapper and ServletConfigImpl - the parameters are stored now in SW,
ServletConfigImpl is a pure facade.
Please, please review the facade package. The main goal is to enable use of un-trusted code.
There are few problems I found:
- core needs protection too ( servlet shouldn't be able to construct core objects or
access them in any way )
- recycling of facades is dangerous - at least one obvious exploit. That means we'll have
to break the one-one relation between internal objects and facade.
- few objects don't have facades ( it is possible to access the AdaptiveClassLoader and call
public methods - very dangerous ).
